instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00687: What is 820-00687? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS: What is PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS? This power rail is PPBUS_G3H after going through a current sense resistor that sits between PPBUS_G3H & the input of PPBUS_G3H to circuitry that provides power for the CPU..
definitions.PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H: What is PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H? This is the input from the USB-C charger or the battery that is the input voltage for the chip responsible for creating PP3V3_G3H. It can be missing when capacitors on this line are shorted to ground, or when the diode in front of it leading to the chip that creates PP3V3_G3H is blown. .
definitions.PP3V3R3V0_AON: What is PP3V3R3V0_AON? PP3V3R3V0_AON is the first power rail you need to get a USB-C charger to go from 5v to 20v on an A1534 Macbook with an 820-00045 board..
definitions.PP5V_G3H: What is PP5V_G3H? PP5V_G3H is a 5v rail present when the machine is in a G3H mechanical off state.
definitions.820-00244: What is 820-00244? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00687</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power <SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> missing
threads.message:
Hi, ive got an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00687</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with no power and <SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> missing 0v , now this line looks like its a dead short to ground but i have noticed (maybe im wrong) that <SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> is connected to the cpu, so would it be safe to inject a little voltage to see what warms up ???, also im using schematics and boardview for the 00244 so i hope thats right. All my other voltages seem correct 
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 19.8v
<SIGNAL>PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H</SIGNAL> = 19.8v
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS</SIGNAL> = 8.6V
<SIGNAL>PPVBUS_LIO</SIGNAL> = 19.8v
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> =19.8v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>=3.3v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3R3V0_AON</SIGNAL> = 3.2v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_G3H</SIGNAL> = 5v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00687</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power <SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> missing
threads.message:
The voltage seems to be generated by <CHIP>U7800</CHIP>; could be the culprit.
But I saw few caps there too; check them first.
If all OK; only remains PCH, which is same as CPU, RIP then...
You can inject tension, but less than 3.5V.
Always start with lower value (e.g. 1V) and go up, maintaining the sink current under power lab supply limit.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00687</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power <SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> missing
threads.message: This does not bode well :( If this was not liquid then I bet the CPU fried. All the more recent Intel CPUs are so prone to either shorting RTC or Vcore.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00687</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power <SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> missing
threads.message: ok , removed <CHIP>U7800</CHIP> and the caps but still shorted , so im guessing dead cpu :-(

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00687</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power <SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> missing
threads.message: Does anyone know if the <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board will work in this as an option ???
